text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PlayStation Portable (PSP) is a handheld game console developed by Sony in 2004 (discontinued in 2014). It marked a turning point in the portable console market by providing graphical capability comparable to that of the home consoles of its time. It has a 32-bit processor, two 3D GPUs (with the ability to decode H.264 encoded video), and a 16:9 aspect ratio screen. It was the first true competitor to rival Nintendo's domination of the handheld market. The PSP Go released on October 2009, featuring a sliding control panel reducing its pocketed size, more built-in storage and Bluetooth.
